de.systemagmbh.common.math
Interface ISysRealFunction

All Known Implementing Classes:
CSysChiSquareDistribution, CSysExponentialRandom, CSysRangeArgumentFunction, CSysWDistributionFunction
Deprecated. As of release 2.5, replaced by de.systemagmbh.tools.math.ISysRealFunction

public interface ISysRealFunction

This interface defines the functionality of a mathematic function of one variable R->R. Since Java does not provide pointers to function, this is the way to pass an arbitrary function to an algorithm. It is useful to find 0-Points, max and min, do Taylor-Expansions, calculate Integrals,... of any CSysRealFunction. See MathTool for some standard algorithms working on CSysRealFunctions.

Example of Usage: 

 
import de.systemagmbh.math.*;
...
double precision=0.001;
Interval interval=new Interval(0.0,1.0); // specify integration interval;

System.out.print("The integral of sin(x) in the interval "+interval+ "is: ");
System.out.println(MathTool.rombachIntegral(interval,precision,
new CSysRealFunction()	// anonymous class instance
{
   public double getValue(double argument)
   {
      return Math.sin(argument);
   }
}           ));
System.out.println("to a precision of:"+precision);

double exact=Math.cos(interval.lower)-Math.cos(interval.upper);
System.out.println("should be exactly:"+exact);
